fields.description:
The current breadcrumb syntax is not particularly useful:

Dashboard  >  SpaceName >  ... > PageAbove > Current page  > View

As soon as you get more than a level deep, the breadcrumbs become much less useful. A user is limited to going to it's parent page, or to the space page (both of which was in the old UI anyway). There are 2 parts of the breadcrumb which have limited functionality- the ellipsis and the "view":
* The ellipsis is useless, as it only references the current page and is no assistance other than visual. Clicking on it does nothing- even though it is an href. 
* View is redundant, because of the tabs directly below it that inform the user if they are in View or Edit mode.

My suggestion:
1. remove view altogether, and use the space for one more level
2. keeping the idea of the ellipsis to save space, use them to represent the levels above - so if I'm six levels deep:
Dashboard  >  SpaceName >  ... > ... > ... > PageAbove > Current page 
The user can still navigate up, but doesn't necessarily see all the page names- maybe limit this to 3-4 ellipsis
3. crop long page names in breadcrumb text to save more space
fields.summary: extend breadcrumbs, remove ellipsis

fields.description:

As it stands, the feature cannot be used with some common API links, like those used with Amazon.com associate IDs. 

-Ted.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-3231].
  {panel}

The mail error queue is currently useless.

* You have no indication what the error is
* All you can do is "resend all" or "delete all"

We need to work on the same principles as an MTA.

* If an error is permanent, give up and log the error somewhere.
* If an error is transient, put it on a queue to resend after a few hours.
* If a transient error keeps happening for a certain amount of time, give up and log the error somewhere.

Also useful would be:

* Keep track of users whose mail fails repeatedly, and stop sending them anything. Flag the account, and have a big note on their profile page saying "Notifications are currently disabled for this account due to repeated mail delivery failures. Please turn notifications back on on your notifications preferences page."
* Mail fails with 'was not a permissible recipient' error should go to Error Queue
* Notification email queue should persist across restarts of Confluence (CONF-3556)
fields.summary: Fix the mail error queue

fields.description:
The mail error queue currently grows without bounds, and it's so well hidden that most administrators won't bother clearing it. From profiling data, it seems to sink a lot of memory per message, which is fine in the outgoing queue, but really bad for anything that hangs around and keeps growing.

Add a task that runs daily, removing anything from the error queue that's more than 48 hours days old.
fields.summary: Clear old messages off mail error queue

I tried rebuilding the index with no luck.

Trying to be really clever I created another page with the exact same name.  I then deleted that page.   Now my Tree View has two links to "Is this a sample question?"  The URLs for the two links are identical.  Clicking on either page gives the Page Deleted error screen.

fields.description:
Attachments appear to be stored locally on the server. This means not only do you have to get storage space allocated on an Oracle db but also on the server (for attachments). It also means, not only do we have to backup the Oracle db but also the server storage to cover off the attachments. It complicates resource allocation, backup strategies and increases implementation costs. 

It would be better if there was an option to store attachments in the Oracle database.
fields.summary: Allow attachments to be stored in the database

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-3191].
{panel}
It'd be really very handy to be able to duplicate a space. Export/import only works on 1 space I think (it seems to have lots of integer ids in there so I dare not try exporting, twiddling things and reimporting).

What would be really nice would be a 'copy space' option where you can duplicate an entire space as a different name/key.

e.g. setting up projects at codehaus; it'd be good to use an existing space as a base, then copy the entire thing, then after that either export/import to search/replace, or just manually modify pages after that. 
{panel:title=Atlassian status as of November 15, 2018|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
Hi all,

Thanks for all your votes and comments on this suggestion.

As previously mentioned, we fully appreciate the value copying a space will bring. This is something we’d ideally like to implement in the future, but it's not currently on our roadmap for the next 12 months. . We’re instead focusing on bringing you a new search experience, and are investigating improvements to permissions.

For more context on this, take a read of the Community blog [A renewed approach to highly voted Server suggestions for Jira and Confluence|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-articles/A-renewed-approach-to-highly-voted-Server-suggestions-for-Jira/ba-p/688117].

There are multiple workarounds available for this issue though - we recommend reading through the related [Confluence documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-copy-or-rename-a-space-in-confluence-169578.html] for more information.

Additionally, as many of you are aware, we implemented the related feature, copy page hierarchy, in 6.0. We hope that you’ll be able to utilize this functionality as an alternative workaround in the meantime.

I apologise for the disappointment and will ensure we provide you with an update on this feature request within the next 12 months.

Best
 Jenny Millman | Product Manager - Confluence Server
{panel}

However, if you move the same plugin.jar file into the /WEB-INF/lib directory, everything magically starts working. Try it with the livesearch.jar, for example, and then go to [confluenceinstallpath]/plugins/livesearch/livesearch.action.

fields.description:
If you upload a broken plug-in which causes an exception when loading, it does the following:

a) Prevents all other 'dropped-in' plug-ins from loading
b) Prevents removal of the offending plug-in.

To fix the problem, you have to stop your web server, delete the offending jar, and restart the webserver. Not fun, particularly when developing a new plug-in, where errors happen semi-frequently. Plus, it doesn't give very good error messages. The one I'm getting at the moment is 'java.lang.NullPointerException'. No stack trace - just the exception classname.
fields.summary: Broken Plug-ins are fatal

fields.summary: Template breadcrumb rendering issue

fields.description:
Pages that start with an umlaut (ä, ö, ü) character should be placed in the a, o, u categories in the index. They are currently visible only when "All" categories" are selected.

"ä" is put after "a" but before "b". "ß" on the other hand is treated like "ss". So it should be Godel, Gödel, Goedeke, Goethe, gotisch.

It is non-trivial to properly do international sorting, but I think Java already has methods to handle this (Collator?).
fields.summary: Page titles with umlaut characters not properly sorted

fields.description:
I created a new space and attempted to rename its "Home" page to "Übersicht". The page is not displayed after renaming, a page not found page is displayed instead. The same error message is displayed when clicking on the space name in the "Your spaces" list.

I think this is critical since it makes the space inaccessible.

The "Übersicht" page is however properly shown when clicking in the corresponding entry in the "Recently Updated" list. Also other places that show this link (nav trails, content tree) work correctly.

fields.description: I just upgraded from 1.4-DR6 to 1.4-RC2 and rebuilt the search index. Then I performed a search and it returned a result for an attachment on a page that no longer exists. It displayed the page with "(Page Deleted)" after the page title and instructed me to talk to the space administrator.
fields.summary: Search results include attachments of deleted pages

fields.description: After upgrading from 1.4-DR6 to 1.4-RC2, I decided to "Rebuild the Search Index". The reindexing process hung and CPU utilization was at 100%. I stopped Tomcat, removed all the files from the index directory and tried again. It hung at a different place. I repeated this many times with the hang always occurring on a different document. There were many different types of exceptions appearing on the console, and one of them mentioned a concurrency error. I cleared the index directory again and restarted Tomcat, but set "CPU Affinity" to just a single CPU -- and that allowed the reindexing process to run successfully without any errors. This indicates that the reindex process has a critical problem on multi-processor servers. I do not yet know if this problem occurs during normal indexer updates or whether it is limited to the reindex process.
fields.summary: Lucene reindexing fails and goes to 100% CPU on multi-processor systems

fields.description:
I want to use Confluence for communication on a wide range of ongoing projects.  One useful feature would be to have a capability for a "management dashboard" where, on a single page, there would be some visible summary information from many pages deeper in the hierarchy.  It seems to me that you have many of the building blocks to do something like this, and just need a few missing pieces to be able to offer a pretty cool new capability.  (And maybe it can be done with what I have and I just don't know how to use it!)

My vision is to have a new macro that would function a lot like the tasklist macro, except that I want "radio button" like behavior instead of checkboxes.  So I would expect the macro to look something like this:

{radiobutton:Project Status}
On hold
In progress, high risk
In progress, normal risk
In progress, low risk
Complete
{radiobutton}

As well as presenting the common radio button user experience, this macro would render in XML as the title of the page it came from and the current selected button.  

Then, in the high level management dashboard, there would be a RSS macro with a query string appropriate to "filter" just the "Project Status" content from the Confluence space in question.  So the management dashboard could provide a very simplistic summary of all the projects in the Confluence space.

I know this is pretty sketchy, and probably needs a lot of refinement.  But it seems like something like this might be pretty easy to create in your product and it might have a lot of market appeal.

Another possible design might use a more specific "status" macro:

{statusreport:Project Status}
On hold
In progress, high risk
In progress, normal risk
In progress, low risk
Complete
{statusreport}

And the statusreport macro might generate a user interface with the radio buttons and a text "log" for explanatory detail; the statusreport could render XML that included the page title, the radio button selection, and the most recent "log" entry.  Again, the management "dashboard" page would use an RSS macro to harvest the statusreports from an unknown number of project pages deep in the space.
fields.summary: Macros to support project management "dashboard"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-3165].
  {panel}

The import functionality may be improved if there would be a way to indicate the parent of the imported page.
Options:
- using a special tag to indicate the parent of the current page
- using the folder structure. This implies that import must create a page for each sub-folder to be referenced by the files within it.

Import functionality is very useful but has the heavy problem that you must to change one by one each imported page to set its parent. This improvement will increase a lot the usefulness of this functionality.
fields.summary: Enable setting a default parent page for imported pages

fields.description:
Confluence should set robots-exclusion headers on all pages that aren't "view page content" or index pages. Looking at google search results for c.a.c, this isn't happening correctly any more.

This seems to be a regression of CONF-1163
fields.summary: Regression: Robots exclusion tags

fields.description: storePage no longer will allow overwrite of a page. Not sure if this is related to the feature request that is still open, but earlier DR releases did not complain. an alternate to the overwrite flag would be to require us to pass in the version we think we are updating or updating to in order to validate no edits have occured. The overwrite flag could then be a "force update" flag.
fields.summary: storePage disallows overwrite

fields.description:
- notification.preferences.header should be translated
- accessing the url http://confluence.atlassian.com/users/viewnotifications.action directly as an anonymous user should redirect to the login page (instead of falling over with a NPE)
fields.summary: i18n bug on notifications page

fields.description: The Jira team found that oracle has been returning 64k strings whenever a string is retrieved from the database, regardless of the actual size of the string data. We need to check if this is also happening within Confluence, and if so, setup a fix.
fields.summary: Check string size returned by Oracle.
Migrate SOAP API to Axis

fields.description:
Would be cool to have a progress indicator bar on file uploads. Some of our docs are upwards of 40 MB, and it'd be nice for end users to know they haven't been forgotten.

Sadly I believe the browsers should solve the problem -- they already provide progress bars for downloads, but not uploads -- but in their absence maybe Atlassian can do something cool with Ajax during ShipIt Day :D
fields.summary: Upload progress indicator

fields.description:
It's currently possible to restore the same space many times in a row. We should check the for the spacekey and refuse the restore if a match is found.  

1. Clean DR6 install.
2. Restored "untouched" Space backup - Space A
3. Create empty new Space - Space B
4. Rename Home page of new Space B to HomeOLD
5. Move (with child) Home of Space A to Space B
6. Made Home the Home of Space B
7. Removed HomeOLD in Space B (not really necessary)
8. All looks wonderful - ie. "empty" Space A and fully populated Space B
9. Restored Space A again - as per step 2
10. When click on Space B get "The page you were trying to reach does not exist". Nothing in logs.
11. In "Browse Space" we can see the pages - when we click on any page we get the page from Space A!!!
fields.summary: Validate space restore request before proceeding
